intro: Vulneraria, commonly known as the "woundwort," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Brassicaceae. These plants are typically herbaceous and can be found in various habitats, including meadows and rocky soils. They are characterized by their small, cruciform flowers and often have hairy stems and leaves. Vulneraria species are known for their ability to thrive in disturbed environments, which is reflected in their common name. The plant's historical use in traditional medicine is also linked to its association with wounds and healing.
